original: No, Dad!
translated: Non, papa !

original: Must this letter be written in English?

original: I suppose you'll need a crowbar to open that crate.

original: It is a miracle that Tom's still alive.

original: I can almost touch the ceiling.

original: You're fashionable.

original: I'm married to a lawyer.

original: A mile is equal to about 1,600 meters.

original: Was it cold?

original: I have no idea how long it'll take.

original: The ohm is the unit of measure for electrical resistance.

original: I suggest we put on some clean clothes.
translated: Je suggère que nous passions des vêtements propres.

original: Did you call him up yesterday?

original: The dog is brown, small, and skinny.

original: I like to suck on frozen ice cream bars in the summer.

original: His play was a hit.

original: It is difficult planning meals for so many people.

original: We won't forget them.

original: Man will die sooner or later.

original: Futurologists have fun pondering about what is to come.

original: Tom is a very naive person.

original: I've been to almost every state.

original: The work is done.

original: Mary is not a huge football fan.

original: It's manna from heaven.

translated: Les « Loups Gris » sont un mouvement ultra-nationaliste turc, néo-fasciste, anti-kurde, qui nie le génocide du peuple arménien.

original: In the privacy of her bedroom she writes in her diary.

original: I think I'm going to stay here.

original: I'm not as afraid of heights as I used to be.

original: I believed that he would keep his promise.

original: Tom sleeps very well in his new bed.

original: Grey translations are indirect translations. In other words, they are translations of the translations, and not translations of the main sentence (the main sentence is the sentence in big letters).
translated: Les traductions grisées sont des traductions indirectes. En d'autres mots, ce sont des traductions de traductions et non des traductions de la phrase principale (la phrase principale est la phrase en lettres de grande taille).

original: That small one is also mine.

original: She beat me at chess.

original: What've you been doing all this time?

original: There is a strong bond of affection between them.

original: He sniffled.

original: I'm a Scorpio.

original: Come sit by us.

original: Tom and Mary are in love.

original: That meat is chicken.

translated: Elle fut gardienne de prison pendant dix ans.

original: Jane was unfairly dismissed from her post.

original: "Would you like to have lunch with us?" "I'd love to, but only if it's no trouble."
translated: « Aimeriez-vous déjeuner avec nous ? » « J'aimerais beaucoup, mais seulement si ça ne pose pas de problème. »

original: You are simply unbearable!

original: The difference between doing and not doing is doing.

original: It did the trick.

original: I love your outfit.

original: We might be able to help her.

original: Tom is about my age.

original: I know Tom is psyched.

original: I know this isn't hard.

original: Sami became Christian.

original: I brought you another blanket.

original: Tom abhors violence.

original: Do you remember?

translated: La publicité est l'art de convaincre les gens de dépenser de l'argent qu'ils n'ont pas pour quelque chose dont ils n'ont pas besoin.

original: They must be cops.

original: I hate ironing.

original: I'm kind of busy right now.

original: Cut!

original: They hung their coats behind the door.

original: I haven't formed an opinion about that yet.

original: I did it for the money.

original: I didn't do this, did I?

original: I try to sleep well.

original: They're arguing.

original: I'm sorry, but he isn't home.

original: She used to be a very shy girl.

original: I made a proposal.

original: You should have seen that movie last night.

original: He'll take an afternoon nap.

original: Does she have to stay at home today?

original: Tom is not the slightest bit interested in my suggestion.

original: We take telephone orders.

original: I don't trust anyone.

original: I thought you might be upset.

original: I can't make heads or tails of what you said.

original: We talked in sign language.

original: I want this fixed as soon as possible.

original: Please knock before you come in.

original: Speak with me.

original: I'll miss you.

original: Do you know what I mean?

original: Tom wanted to be paid in cash.
translated: Tom voulait être payé en espèces.

original: She hired him as an interpreter because she had heard that he was the best.
translated: Elle l'enrôla comme interprète car elle avait entendu dire qu'il était le meilleur.

original: Are you going by bus or car?
translated: Y allez-vous en bus ou en voiture ?

original: You probably just want to be alone.

original: He is Tony.
translated: C'est Tony.

original: Let me know.

original: They believe her.

original: Nice is to the south.
translated: Nice est au sud.

original: I knew you'd be mad.

original: I'm eighty-three years old.

original: I couldn't call you; the telephone was out of order.

original: You are beginners, but you learn quickly.

original: You'd better go. It's getting late.

original: Has this happened before?

original: The biggest damage done to Tatoeba is to change correct sentences that have correct translations.
translated: Les plus gros dommages causés à Tatoeba sont de changer des phrases correctes ayant des traductions correctes.

original: I thought you'd changed.
translated: Je pensais que vous aviez changé.

original: I was singing.

original: I've never seen that before.

original: It is out of the question to learn all these sentences by heart.
translated: Il est hors de question d'apprendre toutes ces peines par cœur.

original: I want to find a box for this.
translated: Je veux trouver une caisse pour ceci.

original: This problem is worth discussing.
translated: Ce problème est digne d'être discuté.

original: It's a quarter to two.
translated: Il est treize heures quarante-cinq.

original: Tom often walks to school.
translated: Tom va souvent à l'école en marchant.

original: It was another hollow promise.
translated: C'était une autre promesse en l'air.

original: No problem!
translated: Aucun problème !

original: You said you'd never leave me alone.
translated: Tu as dit que tu ne me quitterais jamais.

original: Stay here all night if you want.
translated: Reste ici toute la nuit, si tu veux.

original: I don't care what happens.
translated: Je me fiche de ce qu’il advienne.

original: Don't touch it. Leave it as it is.
translated: N'y touche pas. Laisse-le comme il est.

original: How many brothers do you have?
translated: Combien de frères as-tu ?

original: I wish you the same.
translated: Je te souhaite la même chose.

original: Tom staggered.
translated: Tom vacilla.

original: Why don't you love me?
translated: Et si vous m'aimiez ?

original: As it is, I can not pay you.
translated: Dans l'état actuel des choses, je ne peux pas vous payer.

original: Your food is getting cold.
translated: Ton repas est en train de refroidir.

original: Are you drinking?
translated: Êtes-vous en train de boire ?

original: To be honest, we came to capture you.
translated: Pour être honnête, nous sommes venus pour te capturer.

original: I'll explain.
translated: J'expliquerai.

original: Today is Friday.
translated: Nous sommes vendredi.

original: He made me a cake.
translated: Il m'a confectionné un gâteau.

original: This is Tom's knife.
translated: C'est le couteau de Tom.

original: Kim and I are the same age.
translated: Kim et moi, nous avons le même âge.

original: His hair almost covered his whole face.
translated: Ses cheveux recouvraient presque la totalité de son visage.

original: He descended.
translated: Il est descendu.

original: I didn't sign up for this.
translated: Je n'ai pas signé pour ça.

original: Try to be more punctual from now on.
translated: Efforcez-vous d'être plus ponctuelle, désormais.

original: He attempted suicide.
translated: Il a fait une tentative de suicide.

original: Her beauty is incomparable.
translated: Sa beauté est incomparable.

original: Will you have another slice of pie?
translated: Veux-tu une autre part de tarte ?

original: I didn't know Tom could sing so well.
translated: Je ne savais pas que Tom chantait aussi bien.

original: May I help you ma'am?
translated: Puis-je vous aider, madame ?

original: Do you like oranges?
translated: Tu aimes les oranges ?

original: He wants to be a schoolteacher.
translated: Il veut devenir professeur des écoles.

original: You'll never escape that way.
translated: Tu ne t'échapperas jamais de cette manière.

original: I can't find my wallet.
translated: Je n'arrive pas à trouver mon portefeuille.

original: He wanted us to do the shopping.
translated: Il voulait que nous allassions faire les courses.

original: The bay is full of boats and people.
translated: Il y a beaucoup de canots et de gens dans le golfe.

original: Did I win?
translated: Ai-je gagné ?

original: I think we can relax now.
translated: Je pense que nous pouvons maintenant nous détendre.

original: I think it was an accident.
translated: Je pense que c'était un accident.

original: I think you're my best friend.
translated: Je pense que tu es mon meilleur ami.

original: He secretly showed me her picture.
translated: Il m'a montré sa photo en secret.

original: She met him three years ago.
translated: Elle a fait sa connaissance il y a trois ans.

original: Can I at least hug you?
translated: Est-ce que je peux au moins te serrer dans mes bras ?

original: You're not supposed to eat on the job.
translated: Tu n'es pas supposée manger sur le lieu de travail.

original: I've been a teacher for 15 years.
translated: Cela fait quinze ans que je suis enseignant.

original: You're still growing.
translated: Vous êtes encore en train de grandir.

original: That octopus returned to the sea without being eaten.
translated: Cette pieuvre est retournée à la mer sans avoir été mangée.

original: It's a piece of cake.
translated: C'est du gâteau.

original: You're not very tidy.
translated: Vous n'êtes pas très ordonné.

original: Just between us, he doesn't think very deeply.
translated: Entre nous, sa façon de penser manque de profondeur.

original: I want you back today.
translated: Je veux que tu sois revenu aujourd'hui.

original: I can't stand staying indoors.
translated: Je ne supporte pas de rester enfermé.

original: He should come.
translated: Il devrait arriver.

original: He said he'd wait for me to come back.
translated: Il a dit qu'il attendait mon retour.

original: I wish I could believe you.
translated: J'aimerais pouvoir te croire.

original: The Esperanto alphabet consists of 28 letters: a, b, c, ĉ, d, e, f, g, ĝ, h, ĥ, i, j, ĵ, k, l, m, n, o, p, r, s, ŝ, t, u, ŭ, v, z.
translated: L’alphabet de l'espéranto comprend vingt huit lettres : a, b, c, ĉ, d, e, f, g, ĝ, h, ĥ, i, j, ĵ, k, l, m, n, o, p, r, s, ŝ, t, u, ŭ, v, z.

original: Would it be possible for me to get something to drink?
translated: Serait-il possible que j'aie quelque chose à boire ?

original: Is anything up?
translated: Quelque chose se trame-t-il ?

original: Tom promised himself he'd never do that again.
translated: Tom se promit de ne plus jamais refaire cela.

original: Milk? Sugar?
translated: Du lait ? Du sucre ?

original: I took on the job of proofreading.
translated: J'ai pris un emploi de correcteur.

original: Could I borrow some money?
translated: Pourrais-je emprunter de l'argent?

original: A car drew up in front of my house.
translated: Une voiture s'arrêta devant ma maison.

original: He drives roughly.
translated: Il conduit brutalement.

original: The meeting is over.
translated: La réunion est terminée.

original: He hasn't got a bicycle.
translated: Il n'a pas de vélo.

original: Tom slept in this morning.
translated: Tom a fait la grasse matinée aujourd'hui.

original: Are you having fun?
translated: Tu t'amuses bien ?

original: Mary's shoes are dirty.
translated: Les souliers de Marie sont sales.

original: The workers have no incentive to work harder.
translated: Les travailleurs ne sont pas incités à travailler plus dur.

original: He wanted it to be a surprise.
translated: Il voulait que ce soit une surprise.

original: I don't think we need to do that.
translated: Je ne pense pas que nous avons besoin de faire cela.

original: That's absolutely impossible.
translated: C'est absolument impossible.

original: I wasn't trying to hurt anyone.
translated: Je n'essayais pas de blesser qui que ce soit.

original: I've got something for you.
translated: J'ai quelque chose pour toi.

original: You might think I'm too old for you, but I don't think you're too young for me.
translated: Vous pensez peut-être que je suis trop vieux pour vous, mais je ne pense pas que vous êtes trop jeune pour moi.

original: Be content.
translated: Soyez satisfaits !

original: She had no money.
translated: Elle n'avait pas d'argent.

original: To tell the truth, I have lost your pen.
translated: Pour dire la vérité, j'ai perdu ton stylo.

original: Am I the only one?
translated: Suis-je la seule ?

original: He tends to be lazy.
translated: Il tend à être paresseux.

original: Go find out.
translated: Va voir.

original: Don't beg. You're embarrassing yourself.
translated: Ne suppliez pas. Vous vous mettez dans l'embarras.

original: I like my cookies chewy rather than crunchy.
translated: J'aime que mes biscuits soient mous plutôt que croustillants.

original: I would like to make an appointment with the doctor.
translated: J'aimerais avoir un rendez-vous avec le docteur.

original: Don't sound so surprised. You know I can do whatever I want to do.
translated: Ne parais pas si surpris ! Tu sais que je peux faire tout ce que je veux.

original: Why were you holding his hand?
translated: Pourquoi étais-tu en train de lui tenir la main ?

original: When did you take this picture?
translated: Quand avez-vous pris cette photo ?

original: He doesn't know how to code.
translated: Il ne sait pas coder.

original: Chill out!
translated: Tranquille, Émile !

original: It's dark in here.
translated: Il fait noir là-dedans.

original: You need to come home.
translated: Il vous faut venir à la maison.

original: I said I'd tell you the truth.
translated: J'ai dit que je dirais la vérité.

original: Did you get fired from your last job?
translated: Vous êtes-vous fait licencier de votre dernier poste ?

original: I thought that you were happy here.
translated: Je croyais que tu étais heureux ici.

original: That isn't enough.
translated: Ce n'est pas suffisant.

original: The Algerian state does not respect human rights yet it has signed the charter.
translated: L'État algérien ne respecte pas les droits de l'homme pourtant il a signé la charte.

original: We will never countenance terrorism.
translated: Nous ne soutiendrons jamais le terrorisme.

original: We have waited for you the whole day.
translated: Nous vous avons attendu toute la journée.

original: He was absent from school yesterday because he was sick.
translated: Il était absent de l'école hier parce qu'il était malade.

original: I swear to God, if one more person here says "giant robot", you're all as good as dead.
translated: Je le jure devant Dieu, si quelqu'un de plus ici dit "robot géant", vous êtes tous aussi bien que mort.

original: The thousand-year-old tree was cut down by the logger.
translated: L'arbre millénaire a été abattu par le bûcheron.

original: The doctor has no office hours on Monday morning.
translated: Le docteur ne reçoit pas les lundis matin.

original: We can already do that.
translated: On peut déjà le faire.

original: Seriously?
translated: Vraiment ?

original: I give the book to my friend.
translated: Je donne le livre à mon ami.

original: McClellan decided to wait.
translated: McClellan décida d'attendre.

original: When is good for you?
translated: Quand cela te convient-il ?

original: He needs to print a book.
translated: Il doit imprimer un livre.

original: There's musical entertainment from nine o'clock to midnight.
translated: Il y a des animations musicales de neuf heures à minuit.

original: A drunk man's words are a sober man's thoughts.
translated: La vérité est au fond de la bouteille.

original: I was born and raised in Matsuyama.
translated: Je suis né et j'ai grandi à Matsuyama.

original: I attributed the delay in delivery to a traffic jam.
translated: J'attribuais le retard de livraison aux embouteillages.

original: Tom is a thespian.
translated: Tom est un théspien.

original: It was like Christmas morning.
translated: On aurait dit le matin de Noël.

original: How's your old man doing?
translated: Comment va ton père ?

original: What are you doing Monday?
translated: Qu'est-ce que tu fais lundi ?

original: I failed to catch the last bus, and came home by taxi.
translated: Je n'ai pas réussi à attraper le dernier bus et suis rentré à la maison en taxi.

original: Who is your teacher?
translated: Qui est ton professeur ?

original: You are impossible.
translated: Vous êtes insupportable.

original: Have the pixies done the washing up yet?
translated: Les elfes de maison ont-ils déjà fait la lessive ?

original: I am truly sorry.
translated: Je suis vraiment désolé.

original: He liked that.
translated: Il apprécia cela.

original: It is a dull pain.
translated: C’est une douleur sourde.

original: Good evening, how are you?
translated: Bonsoir, ça va ?

original: He continued doing it.
translated: Il a continué à le faire.

original: I have a pen.
translated: J’ai un stylo.

original: I'm allergic to shellfish.
translated: Je suis allergique aux fruits de mer.

original: Mary said she was going to do that tomorrow.
translated: Mary a dit qu'elle allait le faire demain.

original: I object to being treated like a child.
translated: Je refuse d'être traité comme un enfant.

original: I had to park two blocks from here.
translated: J'ai dû me garer à deux pâtés de maison.

original: Are you happy doing that?
translated: Es-tu heureuse de faire ça ?

original: Choose books carefully.
translated: Choisis les livres avec soin.

original: He is saving money so that he may buy a motorcycle.
translated: Il économise pour, peut-être, acheter une moto.

original: I wonder if Tom is really serious.
translated: Je me demande si Tom est vraiment sérieux.

original: They're arriving on the 11 o'clock train.
translated: Ils arrivent par le train de 11h.

original: Are you sure you can handle this?
translated: Êtes-vous sûrs de pouvoir gérer ceci ?

original: I want to apologize for the other day.
translated: Je voudrais présenter mes excuses pour l'autre jour.

original: We have to finish this.
translated: On doit finir ça.

original: What's done is done.
translated: Ce qui est fait, est fait.

original: I've never eaten horsemeat.
translated: Je n’ai jamais mangé de la viande de cheval.

original: I could've done that.
translated: J'aurais pu faire cela.

original: Why is that red light blinking?
translated: Pourquoi est-ce que cette lumière rouge clignote ?

original: How about stopping the car and taking a rest?
translated: Et si on arrêtait la voiture et faisait une pause ?

original: You're experienced.
translated: Vous êtes expérimenté.

original: Don't be so humble, you are not that great.
translated: Ne sois pas si humble, tu n'es pas si renommé.

original: That's just what I'm going to do.
translated: C'est justement ce que je vais faire.

original: Convictions are prisons.
translated: Les convictions sont des prisons.

original: It never happens to me.
translated: Ça ne m'arrive jamais.

original: I can't figure this out.
translated: Je n'arrive pas à le résoudre.

original: A cold front swept over Europe.
translated: Une vague de froid attaqua l'Europe.

original: Get out.
translated: Dégagez !

original: Would you teach me how to dance?
translated: Pourrais-tu m'apprendre à danser ?

original: I was happy to see her.
translated: J'étais heureux de la voir.

original: It didn't happen the way we planned.
translated: Ça ne s'est pas passé comme on l'avait prévu.

original: He is always complaining of ill treatment.
translated: Il se plaint toujours de son traitement médical.

original: You're right about that.
translated: Vous avez raison à ce sujet.

original: I was okay.
translated: J'étais bien.

original: What's the use of talking?
translated: Quelle est l'utilité d'une discussion ?

original: Tom works there.
translated: Tom y travaille.

original: I had my brother clean my room.
translated: J'ai fait ranger ma chambre à mon frère.

original: If for some reason that should happen, what would you do?
translated: Si, pour une raison quelconque, cela devait arriver, que feriez-vous ?

original: All men are equal according to the law.
translated: Tous les hommes sont égaux selon la loi.

original: Let's go to the city.
translated: Rendons-nous en ville !

original: "I drink," he said, "to the buried that repose around us." "And I to your long life."
translated: « Je lève mon verre, dit-il, aux morts qui reposent autour de nous. » « Et moi à votre longue vie. »

original: This is your waitress uniform.
translated: C'est votre uniforme de serveuse.

original: Being only a student, I can't afford to get married.
translated: Étant seulement étudiant, je ne peux pas me permettre de me marier.

original: The TV set worked all night.
translated: Le poste de télévision a fonctionné toute la nuit.

original: Please put it on the table.
translated: Mets-le sur la table, s'il te plaît.

original: Tom turned over.
translated: Tom s'est retourné.

original: The plane still hasn't taken off.
translated: L'avion n'a toujours pas décollé.

original: I wasn't busy yesterday.
translated: Je n'étais pas occupée hier.

original: Why persist in writing essays if one has not even mastered the art of writing succinct sentences?
translated: Pourquoi s'entêter à écrire des dissertations lorsqu'on ne maîtrise pas même l'art d'écrire des phrases succinctes ?

original: The pharmacist passed himself off as a doctor.
translated: Le pharmacien s'est fait passer pour un médecin.

original: How do you plan to handle this?
translated: Comment prévoyez-vous de gérer ceci ?

original: Tom looks intrigued.
translated: Tom a l'air intrigué.

original: I'm glad you could make it.
translated: Je suis ravi que vous ayez pu venir.

original: I don't know how this could have happened.
translated: Je ne sais pas comment ça a pu arriver.

original: As Tom was out of gas, he arrived too late for the meeting.
translated: Comme Tom avait une panne d'essence, il est arrivé trop tard à la réunion.

original: Go straight until you see the post office, then turn right.
translated: Va tout droit jusqu'à ce que tu vois le bureau de la Poste, et ensuite tourne à droite.

original: Did you come here alone?
translated: Êtes-vous venus seuls ici ?

original: Be bold!
translated: Sois intrépide !

original: Where have you been this week?
translated: Où étiez-vous cette semaine ?

original: He is planning to launch his business.
translated: Il projette de lancer son entreprise.

original: Is what you told me secret?
translated: Ce que vous m'avez dit est-il secret ?

original: Tom isn't overweight.
translated: Tom n'est pas en surpoids.

original: Do you want to go swimming? The beach is not far.
translated: Vous voulez aller nager ? La plage n'est pas loin.

original: We're baffled.
translated: Nous sommes perplexes.

original: Would you mind if I changed seats now?
translated: Cela vous dérangerait-il si je changeais de siège maintenant ?

original: It started to rain.
translated: Il s'est mis à pleuvoir.

original: What kind of a person does something like that?
translated: Qui peut faire une chose pareille ?

original: What do you need a doctor for?
translated: Pourquoi as-tu besoin d'un médecin ?

original: The doctor cured her of her disease.
translated: Le docteur l'a guérie de sa maladie.

original: Look down at the floor.
translated: Regardez le sol.

original: I think that Tom will tell you the truth.
translated: Je pense que Tom vous dira la vérité.

original: It had first been suggested that he be skinned alive, that lead be poured into his entrails and that he be let to starve.
translated: On avait proposé d’abord de l’écorcher vif, de lui couler du plomb dans les entrailles, de le faire mourir de faim.

original: Since I broke my foot, I'm walking with crutches.
translated: Depuis que je me suis cassé le pied, je marche avec des béquilles.

original: The girl went to school in spite of her illness.
translated: La fille est allée à l'école malgré sa maladie.

original: He had grown senile recently.
translated: Il devient gâteux depuis peu.

original: We discussed the subject at length.
translated: Nous discutons du sujet en détail.

original: The atomic bomb is a grave threat to mankind.
translated: La bombe atomique est une menace sérieuse pour l'humanité.

original: Thanks a million.
translated: Merci beaucoup.

original: I would like a ratatouille, please.
translated: Je voudrais une ratatouille, s'il vous plaît.

original: The singing of the local birds is akin to the sound of a drill.
translated: Le chant des oiseaux du coin est apparenté au son d'une perceuse.

original: Will you look over my report?
translated: Pouvez-vous jeter un œil à mon rapport ?

original: Tom and his parents moved to Boston.
translated: Tom et ses parents ont déménagé à Boston.

original: I prefer plain materials.
translated: Je préfère les matériaux simples.

original: Take mine.
translated: Prenez les miens.

original: Where are you off to? Should we come with?
translated: Où partez-vous ? Devrions-nous venir avec vous ?

original: Once Tom tried to invoke a demon, and he almost succeeded.
translated: Un jour, Tom a essayé d'invoquer un démon, et il a presque réussi.

original: Where did the bee sting you?
translated: Où l'abeille vous a-t-elle piquée ?

original: Let's move.
translated: On se casse.

original: Poland ceased to exist as a nation for 120 years.
translated: La Pologne cessa d'exister en tant que nation pendant 120 ans.

original: Which is old?
translated: Lequel est ancien ?

original: My world is you!
translated: Mon monde, c'est vous !

original: The room was so dark that we had to feel our way to the door.
translated: La pièce était si sombre que nous dûmes chercher la porte à tâtons.

original: I was nearly run over by a car.
translated: J'ai presque été écrasé par une voiture.

original: That isn't what it means.
translated: Ce n'est pas ce que ça veut dire.

original: Tom took Mary to the hospital.
translated: Tom emmena Mary à l'hôpital.

original: Where art thou?
translated: Où êtes-vous ?

original: Tom doesn't remember where he put his key.
translated: Tom ne se souvient plus où il a mis sa clé.

original: I was talking to him, not you.
translated: C'est à lui que je parlais, pas à toi.

original: Medication and alcohol often don't mix.
translated: Les médicaments et l'alcool font rarement bon ménage.

original: I can finally see the light at the end of the tunnel.
translated: J'arrive enfin à voir la lumière au bout du tunnel.

original: Leave no stone unturned.
translated: Remue ciel et terre !

original: My car is equipped with a CD player.
translated: Ma voiture est équipée d'un lecteur CD.

original: You need a license to drive a car.
translated: Vous avez besoin d'un permis pour conduire une voiture.

original: The violence lasted for two weeks.
translated: La violence persista durant deux semaines.

original: They set up a bronze statue of the hero.
translated: Ils ont érigé une statue en bronze du héros.

original: He tilted his head sideways.
translated: Il a incliné sa tête sur le côté.

original: Tom lost his favorite toy.
translated: Tom a perdu son jouet préféré.

original: I know that you're happy.
translated: Je sais que tu es content.

original: Please tell us where there is a grocery store.
translated: S'il vous plaît, dites-nous où il y a une épicerie.

original: I got shot.
translated: On m'a tiré dessus.

original: The banks rob people, and people rob the banks.
translated: Les banques volent les gens, et les gens volent les banques.

original: He pasted the notice on the door.
translated: Il a collé l'annonce sur la porte.

original: Don't wait for me.
translated: Ne m'attendez pas.

original: He's showing his father his apartment.
translated: Il montre son appartement à son père.

original: His light skin was sprinkled with freckles.
translated: Sa peau claire était parsemée de taches de rousseur.

original: I am tired after swimming in that river.
translated: Je suis fatigué d'avoir nagé dans cette rivière.

original: It is something like a ball.
translated: C'est quelque chose qui ressemble à une balle.

original: There's nothing in the refrigerator except milk.
translated: À part du lait, il n'y a rien dans le frigo.

original: I am hungry because I did not have breakfast.
translated: J'ai faim car je n'ai pas déjeuné.

original: The horse is thirsty.
translated: Le cheval a soif.

original: Tom said that he'd like to know why you didn't do what you said you'd do.
translated: Tom a dit qu'il aimerait savoir pourquoi tu n'as pas fait ce que t'avais dit.

original: Mary is very impressed.
translated: Mary est très impressionnée.

original: Tom is a Native American.
translated: Tom est un Amérindien.

original: Tom sleeps here.
translated: Tom dort ici.

original: Which concert did you choose to attend?
translated: À quel concert as-tu décidé d'aller ?

original: Tom is a good employee.
translated: Tom est un bon employé.

original: Where did you go to school?
translated: Où êtes-vous allés à l'école ?

original: I am thinking of going abroad.
translated: Je songe à me rendre à l'étranger.

original: I hate school! I'm not going.
translated: Je déteste l'école ! Je n'y vais pas.

original: It's a mixed bag.
translated: Il y a à boire et à manger.

original: Shut the door.
translated: Fermez la porte.

original: Breakfast is served.
translated: Le petit-déjeuner est servi.

original: Do circuses still have freak shows?
translated: Les cirques montrent-ils encore des monstres ?

original: You should respect the rules your parents set for you.
translated: Tu devrais respecter les règles que tes parents t'ont fixées.

original: I spent my vacation in the Balearic Islands.
translated: J'ai passé mes vacances aux Baléares.

original: He told us to depart at once.
translated: Il nous a dit de partir immédiatement.

original: We arrived at the museum after a ten-minute walk.
translated: Nous sommes arrivés au musée après dix minutes de marche.

original: Oliver is a thrill-seeker.
translated: Oliver est un amateur de sensations fortes.

original: Dan learned the Slavic languages of all the Eastern European countries he visited.
translated: Dan a appris les langues slaves de tous les pays d'Europe de l'Est qu'il a visités.

original: That's fucked up man.
translated: C'est tordu, mon vieux.

original: I'm travelling alone.
translated: Je voyage seul.

original: I don't menstruate.
translated: Je n'ai pas mes règles.

original: I sent it to you two days ago.
translated: Je vous l'ai envoyée il y a deux jours.

original: Take mine.
translated: Prends le mien.

original: A gunshot was heard in the distance.
translated: Un coup de feu se fit entendre au loin.

original: Don't take any notice of what he says.
translated: Ne tenez aucun compte de ce qu'il dit.

original: Minors are drinking alcohol inside this bar.
translated: Des mineurs boivent de l’alcool dans ce bar.

original: What are you going to do next?
translated: Que vas-tu faire ensuite ?

original: They lost.
translated: Elles ont perdu.

original: I want to see what I'm up against.
translated: Je veux voir à quoi je suis confronté.

original: How about we go for a drink?
translated: Que dis-tu d'aller prendre un verre ?

original: No, I'm waiting for my wife.
translated: Non, j'attends ma femme.

original: They were all in convulsions of laughter.
translated: Ils étaient tous pliés de rire.

original: She said I am the one, but the kid is not my son.
translated: Elle a dit que c'était moi, mais le garçon n'est pas mon fils.

original: How could you not say something?
translated: Comment avez-vous pu ne rien dire ?

original: So, who won the Italian elections?
translated: Donc, qui a remporté les élections italiennes ?

original: I must brush up my English.
translated: Je dois renforcer mon niveau en anglais.

original: I have pain when urinating.
translated: J'éprouve une douleur lorsque j'urine.

original: The cold continued for three weeks.
translated: Le froid continua pendant trois semaines.

original: I must discuss that new plan with him.
translated: Je dois discuter de ce nouveau plan avec lui.

original: I no longer believe it.
translated: Je ne le crois plus.

original: I think I'm in trouble with my wife.
translated: Je pense que j'ai des problèmes avec ma femme.

original: Tom has a car.
translated: Tom a une automobile.

original: French isn't all that difficult to learn.
translated: Le français n'est pas si difficile à apprendre.

original: I guess that doesn't make sense.
translated: Je suppose que ça ne veut rien dire.

original: I look using a flashlight.
translated: Je regarde à l'aide d'une lampe-torche.

original: After winning the Nobel prize, she remained as modest as ever.
translated: Après avoir remporté le prix Nobel, elle est demeurée modeste comme toujours.

original: Do you like the frame on this painting?
translated: Est-ce que tu aimes le cadre de ce tableau ?

original: Tom's a nice guy. Everyone likes him.
translated: Tom est un mec sympa. Tout le monde l'aime.

original: Tom still comes here every day.
translated: Tom vient encore ici tous les jours.

original: Have you ever driven a van?
translated: Avez-vous déjà conduit un van ?

original: My son wants to be a Lincoln.
translated: Mon fils veut ressembler à Lincoln.

original: She was kind to me.
translated: Elle a été gentille avec moi.

original: I don't like a fat diet.
translated: Je n'aime pas la nourriture grasse.

original: The baby is asleep.
translated: Le bébé dort.

original: He pleaded with his mother to let him go to the party.
translated: Il implora sa mère de le laisser aller à la fête.

original: I have been shaking.
translated: J’ai des frissons.

original: I can't judge distance.
translated: Je ne peux pas jauger les distances.

original: Tom couldn't suppress his anger.
translated: Tom ne pouvait réprimer sa colère.

original: Here, everybody feels respected and appreciated.
translated: Ici, chacun se sent respecté et aimé.

original: I'm dripping with sweat.
translated: Je dégouline de sueur.

original: How did you get interested in art?
translated: Comment vous êtes-vous intéressées à l'art ?

original: Life's a bitch!
translated: Putain de vie !

original: Were you invited?
translated: Étiez-vous invité ?

original: Why are you so scared? It's just a movie.
translated: Pourquoi es-tu si effrayé ? Ce n'est qu'un film.

original: When I arrived at the station, the train was just about to leave.
translated: Quand je suis arrivé à la gare, le train était sur le point de partir.

original: Stop asking yourself useless questions.
translated: Arrêtez de vous poser des questions sans intérêt.

original: Don't pretend you don't know.
translated: Ne fais pas comme si tu ne savais pas.

original: My husband is always reading in bed.
translated: Mon mari lit toujours au lit.

original: Her hair is silky smooth.
translated: Ses cheveux sont doux comme la soie.

original: Who can afford this anymore?
translated: Qui peut encore se permettre ceci ?

original: Becky is by far the best nurse in the whole hospital.
translated: Becky est de loin la meilleure infirmière de tout l'hôpital.

original: One must pay for freedom.
translated: On doit payer pour la liberté.

original: Are you worn out?
translated: Es-tu épuisé ?

original: It's better not to say anything about her to him.
translated: Il est préférable de ne rien lui dire à propos d'elle.

original: He is our teacher of English.
translated: Il est notre professeur d'anglais.

original: The surgeon's suture technique minimizes scarring.
translated: La technique de suture du chirurgien minimise les cicatrices.

original: Hi. How are you doing?
translated: Salut ! Comment vas-tu ?

original: We pigged out on pizza and chicken at lunchtime.
translated: Nous nous sommes empiffrés avec de la pizza et du poulet pour déjeuner.

original: I have finished.
translated: J'ai terminé.

original: I've started going out with Tom.
translated: J'ai commencé à sortir avec Tom.

original: Xavier is a young student in economics at Paris University.
translated: Xavier est un jeune étudiant en économie à l’université de Paris.

original: Are you productive?
translated: Es-tu productif ?

original: He is short, but strong.
translated: Il est petit mais fort.

original: I've got three tickets.
translated: J'ai trois billets.

original: Tom doesn't know why Mary doesn't want him at her party.
translated: Tom ne sait pas pourquoi Marie ne veut pas de lui à sa soirée.

original: The cherry trees in bloom are very beautiful.
translated: Les cerisiers en fleurs sont magnifiques.

original: I wonder why Tom never does that.
translated: Je me demande pourquoi Tom ne fait jamais ça.

original: We have to leave.
translated: Nous devons y aller.

original: By God!
translated: Mon Dieu !

original: The cost of living is very high in Tokyo.
translated: Le coût de la vie à Tokyo est très élevé.

original: She says that she did nothing wrong.
translated: Elle dit qu'elle n'a rien fait de mal.

original: You aren't supposed to swim here.
translated: Vous n'êtes pas censées nager ici.

original: Sometimes I stay for three hours at Tatoeba.
translated: Quelquefois je reste trois heures sur Tatoeba.

original: They can't fire you.
translated: Elles ne peuvent pas vous virer.

original: My hobby is cooking.
translated: Mon passe-temps est la cuisine.

original: I'm glad to see you're happy.
translated: Je me réjouis de vous voir heureuse.
